program_info.name: The Colorado Experiment Protocol
program_info.subtitle: Arthur Jones High-Intensity Training Method
program_info.creator: Arthur Jones
program_info.description: Based on the legendary 28-day experiment that produced 63 pounds of muscle gain in Casey Viator. This ultra-high intensity, low-volume protocol emphasizes one set to absolute failure per exercise, brief workouts, and full recovery between sessions.
program_info.warning: This is an extremely demanding protocol. Only attempt if you have solid training experience and excellent recovery capacity. The original experiment had unique circumstances (muscle memory, pharmaceutical enhancement) that contributed to extraordinary results.
key_principles: One set to absolute muscular failure per exercise
Slow, controlled repetitions (4 seconds up, 4 seconds down)

schedule.notes: Absolutely no training on rest days. Recovery is critical to this protocol's success.

workout_phases.description: Introduction to high-intensity training. Focus on learning proper form and intensity level required.

exercises.instructions: Load weight to reach failure between 8-12 reps. Once you cannot complete another full rep with proper form, the set is over. No partial reps. Focus on controlled descent (4 seconds) and explosive push (4 seconds).
exercises.failure_protocol: Continue pushing until you cannot move the weight. Have a spotter for safety.
exercises.progression_notes: If you achieve 12 reps with good form, increase weight by 5-10% next session.

exercises.instructions: Focus on the negative (lowering) portion. Control the weight down for 4 full seconds.
exercises.failure_protocol: When you cannot complete another rep, have partner provide assisted positive (lifting) while you do one more negative rep.
exercises.progression_notes: Add weight when you hit 12 clean reps.

exercises.instructions: Pre-exhaust technique. Keep tension constant - don't lock out at the top.
exercises.failure_protocol: Push to complete failure. This should burn intensely.
exercises.progression_notes: Increase weight once 12 reps is achievable.

exercises.instructions: Isolate lats. Keep arms relatively straight. Focus on pulling with back, not arms.
exercises.failure_protocol: Continue until arms cannot pull weight another inch.
exercises.progression_notes: Add weight at 12 reps or switch to heavier dumbbell.

exercises.instructions: Pull to lower chest. Squeeze shoulder blades together. Control the negative.
exercises.failure_protocol: Row until you cannot maintain form. No cheating.
exercises.progression_notes: Increase weight when 12 strict reps achieved.

exercises.exercise_name: Chest Press Machine or Barbell Bench Press
exercises.instructions: Lower weight slowly (4 seconds). Press explosively but controlled (4 seconds).
exercises.failure_protocol: Press until arms will not extend. Use spotter for safety with barbell.
exercises.progression_notes: Add weight at 12 reps. Machine preferred for safety when training to failure.

exercises.exercise_name: Shoulder Press Machine or Dumbbell Press
exercises.instructions: Full range of motion. Control descent. Press to just before lockout.
exercises.failure_protocol: Press until shoulders give out completely.

exercises.instructions: Strict form. No swinging. Lead with elbows, not hands.
exercises.failure_protocol: Raise until you cannot lift arms another degree.

exercises.exercise_name: Tricep Extension Machine or Cable Pushdown
exercises.instructions: Keep elbows stationary. Full extension and stretch.
exercises.failure_protocol: Extend until triceps cannot push weight.

exercises.instructions: No momentum. Strict curl. Control the negative especially.
exercises.failure_protocol: Curl until arms cannot bend another inch.

exercises.instructions: Full stretch at bottom, full contraction at top. Pause 1 second at top.
exercises.failure_protocol: Raise until calves are completely exhausted.
exercises.progression_notes: Calves respond to higher reps. Add weight at 20 reps.

exercises.exercise_name: Abdominal Crunch Machine or Weighted Crunch
exercises.instructions: Add resistance. Treat abs like any other muscle. Last exercise of workout.
exercises.failure_protocol: Crunch until abs cannot contract.

workout_phases.description: Maximum intensity. Push every set beyond what you think is possible. This is where extraordinary gains occur.
advanced_techniques: Forced reps (2-3 with partner assistance after failure)
Negative reps (partner lifts, you lower for 6-8 seconds)
Rest-pause (rest 10 seconds after failure, do 2-3 more reps)
Static holds (hold weight at hardest point for 10 seconds after failure)

exercises.instructions: Deep squat. Ass to grass if mobility allows. This replaces leg press for maximum intensity.
exercises.failure_protocol: Squat to absolute failure. Use safety bars/rack. After failure, do 2 forced reps with spotter.
exercises.progression_notes: Add weight at 10 reps. This is the king of exercises.

exercises.instructions: Keep legs nearly straight. Feel stretch in hamstrings. Maintain neutral spine.
exercises.failure_protocol: Continue until hamstrings/lower back cannot support load. Use straps if grip fails first.

exercises.instructions: Add weight with belt/vest. Pull to chest. Control negative.
exercises.failure_protocol: Pull to failure, then have partner assist for 2 more reps. Follow with 8-second negative.

exercises.instructions: Heavy weight. Pull to sternum. Squeeze hard at top.
exercises.failure_protocol: Row to failure. Rest 10 seconds, do 3 more reps (rest-pause).

exercises.instructions: 30-45 degree incline. Lower to upper chest. Press to lockout.
exercises.failure_protocol: Press to failure. Spotter assists for 3 more forced reps.

exercises.instructions: Lean forward for chest emphasis. Full depth. Add weight with belt.
exercises.failure_protocol: Dip to failure. Partner assists for 2 more reps, then hold top position 10 seconds.

exercises.instructions: Strict press from clavicle to overhead. No leg drive. Core tight.
exercises.failure_protocol: Press to failure. Do one 8-second negative rep with heavier weight.

exercises.instructions: Hands shoulder-width. Keep elbows close to body. Lower to lower chest.
exercises.failure_protocol: Press to failure. Spotter helps for 3 forced reps.

exercises.instructions: No swinging. Strict form. Use EZ-bar if wrist strain.
exercises.failure_protocol: Curl to failure. Rest 10 seconds, do 3 more reps. Then one 8-second negative.

exercises.instructions: Full stretch, full contraction. Pause at top.
exercises.failure_protocol: Raise to complete failure. Hold top position for 15 seconds.

exercises.exercise_name: Weighted Ab Crunch or Cable Crunch
exercises.instructions: Heavy resistance. Treat abs as strength muscle.
exercises.failure_protocol: Crunch to failure. Hold contraction 10 seconds.

workout.cool_down: 5 minutes light stretching. Immediate post-workout nutrition critical.

nutrition_protocol.description: The Colorado Experiment used extremely high protein intake and controlled calorie surplus to support rapid muscle growth.

meal_timing.pre_workout: Complex carbs + moderate protein 90 minutes before
meal_timing.post_workout: Fast protein (whey) + simple carbs within 30 minutes

supplements_used_original: Note: The original experiment likely included performance-enhancing drugs, which contributed to the extraordinary results

recovery_protocol.active_recovery: Light walking only on rest days. No cardio, no sports.
recovery_protocol.stress_management: Critical - high cortisol inhibits muscle growth
recovery_protocol.deload_weeks: None - this is only 4 weeks. If continuing beyond, take full week off every 4-6 weeks.

progression_rules.weight_increase_criteria: When you achieve the upper rep range with perfect form
progression_rules.failure_to_progress: If you fail to add weight/reps for 2 consecutive workouts, take 3 days off, then retry with same weight
progression_rules.action_if_overtrained: Take full week off. Resume at 80% intensity for one week before returning to full protocol.

safety_warnings: This protocol requires perfect form. Sacrifice weight for technique.
Training to failure requires spotters for most exercises.
Do not attempt this protocol if you're a beginner. Minimum 2 years consistent training experience required.
The original experiment had unique circumstances (muscle memory, pharmaceutical enhancement) that cannot be replicated naturally.
If you experience joint pain, reduce intensity immediately.
This is not sustainable long-term. Maximum 4-6 weeks before switching to different protocol.

expected_results.note: The original 63 lbs in 28 days is not realistic for natural athletes without muscle memory from significant prior development. Casey Viator was an elite bodybuilder regaining lost mass after an accident.

weekly_tracking.workout_performance: Log all weights and reps achieved

after_completion.progress_photos: Same lighting, angles, time of day
after_completion.strength_retest: Test 1RM on main lifts after 3-5 day rest

references.original_study: Colorado Experiment, May 1973, Colorado State University
references.subject: Casey Viator, supervised by Arthur Jones
references.documentation: Published in Athletic Journal and Ironman Magazine
references.scientific_validity: Not peer-reviewed, anecdotal case study, numerous confounding variables
